course_title: Epidemiological & Research Methods for Animal & Veterinary Biosciences

learning_outcomes.description: Write a structured literature review on a selected topic which includes a critical evaluation of the validity of scientific evidence.
Develop a research question. Formulate specific, answerable research questions and develop testable hypotheses.

Manage data in spreadsheets, perform basic data manipulation using a statistical package, apply basic statistical methods, classify types of data and graph the distribution of the data. Explain statistical power and calculate sample size required for a simple study.

Explain the purpose and scope of the NHMRC Code of Practice for the Care and Use of Animals for Scientific Purposes and the NHMRC National Statement on Ethical conduct Involving Humans in Research and their relationship with state legislation.
Prepare a research proposal, including background with brief literature review, clear aims and objectives and hypotheses, and appropriate methodology.

For a given data set, select and conduct an appropriate statistical test for a simple comparison, interpret output from a statistical package, and present the results as a publication-quality graph together with a clearly understandable explanatory legend.

assessments.task_description: Students must formulate a structured research question, conduct a literature search and write a very brief literature review.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assessment task is to be submitted electronically via blackboard by the due date and time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Epi quiz 1: Causality, study design and bias
assessments.due_date:
29/08/2024 - 30/08/2024

The quiz is open from 29 Aug 24 8:00 until 30 Aug 24 14:00. Students have 60 minutes to complete the quiz once they have commenced the quiz.
assessments.task_description: The online quiz will consist of 11 short answer and multiple choice questions relating to concepts of causation, study design and bias.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Epi quiz 2: Basic stats, power and sample size
assessments.due_date:
12/09/2024 - 13/09/2024

The quiz is open from 12 Sep 24 8:00 until 13 Sep 24 14:00. Students have 120 minutes to complete the quiz once they have commenced the quiz.
assessments.task_description: The quiz will consist of 11 short answer and multiple choice questions relating to measures of association, basic statistics, sample size and power calculations. Students may be required to perform simple calculations from given data.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Students must design a simple research proposal and compile an appropriate data collection spreadsheet.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment is to be submitted electronically via blackboard by the due date and time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Create a publication quality graphic with legend
assessments.task_description: Using own data, or a provided data set, students must create a publication quality matrix scatterplot and a boxplot, using a statistical package. The graphs must be accompanied by an appropriate legend.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment is to be submitted electronically via blackboard by the due date and time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
